intro: Stelephuros pratensis, commonly known as the meadow stelephorus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are usually alternate, finely divided, and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Stelephuros pratensis is often used in herbal medicine for its purported calming and digestive properties.
